extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.kinesis.firehose.PutKinesisFirehose
extension.description: Sends the contents to a specified Amazon Kinesis Firehose. In order to send data to firehose, the firehose delivery stream name has to be specified.

property.name: Amazon Kinesis Firehose Delivery Stream Name
property.displayName: Amazon Kinesis Firehose Delivery Stream Name
property.description: The name of kinesis firehose delivery stream

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: Batch size for messages (1-500).

property.name: Max message buffer size
property.description: Max message buffer

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.firehose.error.message
writesAttribute.description: Error message on posting message to AWS Kinesis Firehose

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.firehose.error.code
writesAttribute.description: Error code for the message when posting to AWS Kinesis Firehose

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.firehose.record.id
writesAttribute.description: Record id of the message posted to Kinesis Firehose

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.dynamodb.PutDynamoDB
extension.description: Puts a document from DynamoDB based on hash and range key. The table can have either hash and range or hash key alone. Currently the keys supported are string and number and value can be json document. In case of hash and range keys both key are required for the operation. The FlowFile content must be JSON. FlowFile content is mapped to the specified Json Document attribute in the DynamoDB item.

property.name: Table Name
property.description: The DynamoDB table name

property.name: Hash Key Name
property.description: The hash key name of the item

property.name: Range Key Name
property.description: The range key name of the item

property.name: Hash Key Value
property.description: The hash key value of the item

property.name: Hash Key Value Type
property.description: The hash key value type of the item

property.name: Range Key Value Type
property.description: The range key value type of the item

property.name: Json Document attribute
property.description: The Json document to be retrieved from the dynamodb item

property.name: Character set of document
property.description: Character set of data in the document

property.name: Batch items for each request (between 1 and 50)
property.displayName: Batch items for each request (between 1 and 50)
property.description: The items to be retrieved in one batch

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

relationship.name: unprocessed
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to unprocessed relationship when DynamoDB is not able to process all the items in the request. Typical reasons are insufficient table throughput capacity and exceeding the maximum bytes per request. Unprocessed FlowFiles can be retried with a new request.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.key.error.unprocessed
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db unprocessed keys

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.exception.message

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.lambda.PutLambda

writesAttribute.name: aws.lambda.exception.error.type

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.PutS3Object
extension.description: Puts FlowFiles to an Amazon S3 Bucket. The upload uses either the PutS3Object method or the PutS3MultipartUpload method. The PutS3Object method sends the file in a single synchronous call, but it has a 5GB size limit. Larger files are sent using the PutS3MultipartUpload method. This multipart process saves state after each step so that a large upload can be resumed with minimal loss if the processor or cluster is stopped and restarted. A multipart upload consists of three steps: 1) initiate upload, 2) upload the parts, and 3) complete the upload. For multipart uploads, the processor saves state locally tracking the upload ID and parts uploaded, which must both be provided to complete the upload. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this can be overridden with the 'Endpoint Override URL' property for use with other S3-compatible endpoints. The S3 API specifies that the maximum file size for a PutS3Object upload is 5GB. It also requires that parts in a multipart upload must be at least 5MB in size, except for the last part. These limits establish the bounds for the Multipart Upload Threshold and Part Size properties.

property.name: Content Type
property.description: Sets the Content-Type HTTP header indicating the type of content stored in the associated object. The value of this header is a standard MIME type. AWS S3 Java client will attempt to determine the correct content type if one hasn't been set yet. Users are responsible for ensuring a suitable content type is set when uploading streams. If no content type is provided and cannot be determined by the filename, the default content type "application/octet-stream" will be used.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: s3-object-tags-prefix
property.description: Specifies the prefix which would be scanned against the incoming FlowFile's attributes and the matching attribute's name and value would be considered as the outgoing S3 object's Tag name and Tag value respectively. For Ex: If the incoming FlowFile carries the attributes tagS3country, tagS3PII, the tag prefix to be specified would be 'tagS3'

property.name: s3-object-remove-tags-prefix
property.description: If set to 'True', the value provided for 'Object Tags Prefix' will be removed from the attribute(s) and then considered as the Tag name. For ex: If the incoming FlowFile carries the attributes tagS3country, tagS3PII and the prefix is set to 'tagS3' then the corresponding tag values would be 'country' and 'PII'

property.name: FullControl User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Full Control for an object

property.name: Read Permission User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Read Access for an object

property.name: Write Permission User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Write Access for an object

property.name: Read ACL User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have permissions to read the Access Control List for an object

property.name: Write ACL User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have permissions to change the Access Control List for an object

property.name: Owner
property.description: The Amazon ID to use for the object's owner

property.name: canned-acl
property.description: Amazon Canned ACL for an object, one of: BucketOwnerFullControl, BucketOwnerRead, LogDeliveryWrite, AuthenticatedRead, PublicReadWrite, PublicRead, Private; will be ignored if any other ACL/permission/owner property is specified

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS libraries use the default signer but this property allows you to specify a custom signer to support older S3-compatible services.

property.name: Multipart Threshold
property.description: Specifies the file size threshold for switch from the PutS3Object API to the PutS3MultipartUpload API. Flow files bigger than this limit will be sent using the stateful multipart process. The valid range is 50MB to 5GB.

property.name: Multipart Part Size
property.description: Specifies the part size for use when the PutS3Multipart Upload API is used. Flow files will be broken into chunks of this size for the upload process, but the last part sent can be smaller since it is not padded. The valid range is 50MB to 5GB.

property.name: Multipart Upload AgeOff Interval
property.description: Specifies the interval at which existing multipart uploads in AWS S3 will be evaluated for ageoff. When processor is triggered it will initiate the ageoff evaluation if this interval has been exceeded.

property.name: Multipart Upload Max Age Threshold
property.description: Specifies the maximum age for existing multipart uploads in AWS S3. When the ageoff process occurs, any upload older than this threshold will be aborted.

property.name: server-side-encryption
property.description: Specifies the algorithm used for server side encryption.

property.name: encryption-service
property.description: Specifies the Encryption Service Controller used to configure requests. PutS3Object: For backward compatibility, this value is ignored when 'Server Side Encryption' is set. FetchS3Object: Only needs to be configured in case of Server-side Customer Key, Client-side KMS and Client-side Customer Key encryptions.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

dynamicProperty.name: The name of a User-Defined Metadata field to add to the S3 Object
dynamicProperty.value: The value of a User-Defined Metadata field to add to the S3 Object
dynamicProperty.description: Allows user-defined metadata to be added to the S3 object as key/value pairs

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

readsAttribute.name: filename
readsAttribute.description: Uses the FlowFile's filename as the filename for the S3 object

writesAttribute.name: s3.bucket
writesAttribute.description: The S3 bucket where the Object was put in S3

writesAttribute.name: s3.key
writesAttribute.description: The S3 key within where the Object was put in S3

writesAttribute.name: s3.contenttype
writesAttribute.description: The S3 content type of the S3 Object that put in S3

writesAttribute.name: s3.version
writesAttribute.description: The version of the S3 Object that was put to S3

writesAttribute.name: s3.etag
writesAttribute.description: The ETag of the S3 Object

writesAttribute.name: s3.uploadId
writesAttribute.description: The uploadId used to upload the Object to S3

writesAttribute.name: s3.expiration
writesAttribute.description: A human-readable form of the expiration date of the S3 object, if one is set

writesAttribute.name: s3.sseAlgorithm
writesAttribute.description: The server side encryption algorithm of the object

writesAttribute.name: s3.usermetadata
writesAttribute.description: A human-readable form of the User Metadata of the S3 object, if any was set

writesAttribute.name: s3.encryptionStrategy
writesAttribute.description: The name of the encryption strategy, if any was set

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.cloudwatch.PutCloudWatchMetric
extension.description: Publishes metrics to Amazon CloudWatch. Metric can be either a single value, or a StatisticSet comprised of minimum, maximum, sum and sample count.

property.name: Namespace
property.description: The namespace for the metric data for CloudWatch

property.name: MetricName
property.description: The name of the metric

property.name: Value
property.description: The value for the metric. Must be a double

property.name: maximum
property.description: The maximum value of the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: minimum
property.description: The minimum value of the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: sampleCount
property.description: The number of samples used for the statistic set. Must be a double

property.name: sum
property.description: The sum of values for the sample set. Must be a double

property.name: Timestamp
property.description: A point in time expressed as the number of milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC. If not specified, the default value is set to the time the metric data was received

property.name: Unit
property.description: The unit of the metric. (e.g Seconds, Bytes, Megabytes, Percent, Count, Kilobytes/Second, Terabits/Second, Count/Second) For details see http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/APIReference/API_MetricDatum.html

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

dynamicProperty.name: Dimension Name
dynamicProperty.description: Allows dimension name/value pairs to be added to the metric. AWS supports a maximum of 10 dimensions.

relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.wag.InvokeAWSGatewayApi
extension.description: Client for AWS Gateway API endpoint

property.name: aws-gateway-http-method
property.description: HTTP request method (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, HEAD, OPTIONS).Methods other than POST, PUT and PATCH will be sent without a message body.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: aws-gateway-resource
property.description: The Name of the Gateway API Resource

property.name: aws-gateway-api-endpoint
property.description: The Api Endpoint

property.name: aws-gateway-api-key
property.description: The API Key

property.name: aws-gateway-attributes-to-send
property.description: Regular expression that defines which attributes to send as HTTP headers in the request. If not defined, no attributes are sent as headers. Also any dynamic properties set will be sent as headers. The dynamic property key will be the header key and the dynamic property value will be interpreted as expression language will be the header value.

property.name: aws-gateway-put-response-body-in-attribute
property.description: If set, the response body received back will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. The attribute key to put to is determined by evaluating value of this property.

property.name: aws-gateway-content-type
property.description: The Content-Type to specify for when content is being transmitted through a PUT, POST or PATCH. In the case of an empty value after evaluating an expression language expression, Content-Type defaults to application/octet-stream

property.name: aws-gateway-send-message-body
property.description: If true, sends the HTTP message body on POST/PUT/PATCH requests (default). If false, suppresses the message body and content-type header for these requests.

property.name: aws-gateway-always-output-response
property.description: Will force a response FlowFile to be generated and routed to the 'Response' relationship regardless of what the server status code received is or if the processor is configured to put the server response body in the request attribute. In the later configuration a request FlowFile with the response body in the attribute and a typical response FlowFile will be emitted to their respective relationships.

property.name: aws-gateway-penalize-no-retry
property.description: Enabling this property will penalize FlowFiles that are routed to the "No Retry" relationship.

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

property.name: aws-gateway-query-parameters
property.description: The query parameters for this request in the form of Name=Value separated by &

property.name: aws-gateway-max-attribute-length
property.displayName: Max Length To Put In Attribute
property.description: If routing the response body to an attribute of the original (by setting the "Put response body in attribute" property or by receiving an error status code), the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will be truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.

property.name: aws-gateway-add-response-headers-request
property.description: Enabling this property saves all the response headers to the original request. This may be when the response headers are needed but a response is not generated due to the status code received.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

dynamicProperty.name: Header Name
dynamicProperty.description: Send request header with a key matching the Dynamic Property Key and a value created by evaluating the Attribute Expression Language set in the value of the Dynamic Property.

relationship.name: Original
relationship.description: The original FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the success of the request.

relationship.name: Failure
relationship.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any type of connection failure, timeout or general exception. It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationship.name: Retry
relationship.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that can be retried (5xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationship.name: No Retry
relationship.description: The original FlowFile will be routed on any status code that should NOT be retried (1xx, 3xx, 4xx status codes). It will have new attributes detailing the request.

relationship.name: Response
relationship.description: A Response FlowFile will be routed upon success (2xx status codes). If the 'Output Response Regardless' property is true then the response will be sent to this relationship regardless of the status code received.

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: The MIME Type of the flowfiles

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.status.code
writesAttribute.description: The status code that is returned

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.status.message
writesAttribute.description: The status message that is returned

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.response.body
writesAttribute.description: In the instance where the status code received is not a success (2xx)

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.resource
writesAttribute.description: The request resource

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.tx.id
writesAttribute.description: The transaction ID that is returned after reading the response

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.java.exception.class
writesAttribute.description: The Java exception class raised when the processor fails

writesAttribute.name: aws.gateway.api.java.exception.message
writesAttribute.description: The Java exception message raised when the processor fails

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.kinesis.stream.PutKinesisStream
extension.description: Sends the contents to a specified Amazon Kinesis. In order to send data to Kinesis, the stream name has to be specified.

property.name: kinesis-stream-name
property.description: The name of Kinesis Stream

property.name: amazon-kinesis-stream-partition-key
property.description: The partition key attribute. If it is not set, a random value is used

property.name: message-batch-size
property.description: Batch size for messages (1-500).

property.name: max-message-buffer-size
property.description: Max message buffer size in Mega-bytes

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.error.message
writesAttribute.description: Error message on posting message to AWS Kinesis

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.error.code
writesAttribute.description: Error code for the message when posting to AWS Kinesis

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.sequence.number
writesAttribute.description: Sequence number for the message when posting to AWS Kinesis

writesAttribute.name: aws.kinesis.shard.id
writesAttribute.description: Shard id of the message posted to AWS Kinesis

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.FetchS3Object
extension.description: Retrieves the contents of an S3 Object and writes it to the content of a FlowFile

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: Version
property.description: The Version of the Object to download

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS libraries use the default signer but this property allows you to specify a custom signer to support older S3-compatible services.

property.name: encryption-service
property.description: Specifies the Encryption Service Controller used to configure requests. PutS3Object: For backward compatibility, this value is ignored when 'Server Side Encryption' is set. FetchS3Object: Only needs to be configured in case of Server-side Customer Key, Client-side KMS and Client-side Customer Key encryptions.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

property.name: requester-pays
property.description: If true, indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with retrieving objects from the S3 bucket. This sets the 'x-amz-request-payer' header to 'requester'.

allowableValue.description: Indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with retrieving objects from the S3 bucket.
Does not consent to pay requester charges for retrieving objects from the S3 bucket.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

writesAttribute.name: s3.bucket
writesAttribute.description: The name of the S3 bucket

writesAttribute.name: path
writesAttribute.description: The path of the file

writesAttribute.name: absolute.path
writesAttribute.description: The path of the file

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: hash.value
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 sum of the file

writesAttribute.name: hash.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: MD5

writesAttribute.name: mime.type
writesAttribute.description: If S3 provides the content type/MIME type, this attribute will hold that file

writesAttribute.name: s3.etag
writesAttribute.description: The ETag that can be used to see if the file has changed

writesAttribute.name: s3.expirationTime
writesAttribute.description: If the file has an expiration date, this attribute will be set, containing the milliseconds since epoch in UTC time

writesAttribute.name: s3.expirationTimeRuleId
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the rule that dictates this object's expiration time

writesAttribute.name: s3.sseAlgorithm
writesAttribute.description: The server side encryption algorithm of the object

writesAttribute.name: s3.version
writesAttribute.description: The version of the S3 object

writesAttribute.name: s3.encryptionStrategy
writesAttribute.description: The name of the encryption strategy that was used to store the S3 object (if it is encrypted)

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.sqs.GetSQS
extension.description: Fetches messages from an Amazon Simple Queuing Service Queue

property.name: Queue URL
property.description: The URL of the queue to act upon

property.name: Auto Delete Messages
property.description: Specifies whether the messages should be automatically deleted by the processors once they have been received.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The maximum number of messages to send in a single network request

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The Character Set that should be used to encode the textual content of the SQS message

property.name: Visibility Timeout
property.description: The amount of time after a message is received but not deleted that the message is hidden from other consumers

property.name: Receive Message Wait Time
property.description: The maximum amount of time to wait on a long polling receive call. Setting this to a value of 1 second or greater will reduce the number of SQS requests and decrease fetch latency at the cost of a constantly active thread.

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

writesAttribute.name: hash.value
writesAttribute.description: The MD5 sum of the message

writesAttribute.name: hash.algorithm
writesAttribute.description: MD5

writesAttribute.name: sqs.message.id
writesAttribute.description: The unique identifier of the SQS message

writesAttribute.name: sqs.receipt.handle
writesAttribute.description: The SQS Receipt Handle that is to be used to delete the message from the queue

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.DeleteS3Object
extension.description: Deletes FlowFiles on an Amazon S3 Bucket. If attempting to delete a file that does not exist, FlowFile is routed to success.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: Version
property.description: The Version of the Object to delete

property.name: FullControl User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Full Control for an object

property.name: Read Permission User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Read Access for an object

property.name: Write Permission User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have Write Access for an object

property.name: Read ACL User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have permissions to read the Access Control List for an object

property.name: Write ACL User List
property.description: A comma-separated list of Amazon User ID's or E-mail addresses that specifies who should have permissions to change the Access Control List for an object

property.name: Owner
property.description: The Amazon ID to use for the object's owner

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS libraries use the default signer but this property allows you to specify a custom signer to support older S3-compatible services.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.sns.PutSNS
extension.description: Sends the content of a FlowFile as a notification to the Amazon Simple Notification Service

property.name: Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
property.description: The name of the resource to which notifications should be published

property.name: ARN Type
property.description: The type of Amazon Resource Name that is being used.

allowableValue.description: The ARN is the name of a topic
The ARN is the name of a particular Target, used to notify a specific subscriber

property.name: E-mail Subject
property.description: The optional subject to use for any subscribers that are subscribed via E-mail

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: Use JSON Structure
property.description: If true, the contents of the FlowFile must be JSON with a top-level element named 'default'. Additional elements can be used to send different messages to different protocols. See the Amazon SNS Documentation for more information.

property.name: Character Set
property.description: The character set in which the FlowFile's content is encoded

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.TagS3Object
extension.description: Sets tags on a FlowFile within an Amazon S3 Bucket. If attempting to tag a file that does not exist, FlowFile is routed to success.

property.name: version
property.description: The Version of the Object to tag

property.name: tag-key
property.description: The key of the tag that will be set on the S3 Object

property.name: tag-value
property.description: The value of the tag that will be set on the S3 Object

property.name: append-tag
property.description: If set to true, the tag will be appended to the existing set of tags on the S3 object. Any existing tags with the same key as the new tag will be updated with the specified value. If set to false, the existing tags will be removed and the new tag will be set on the S3 object.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS libraries use the default signer but this property allows you to specify a custom signer to support older S3-compatible services.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

writesAttribute.name: s3.tag.___
writesAttribute.description: The tags associated with the S3 object will be written as part of the FlowFile attributes

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.dynamodb.GetDynamoDB
extension.description: Retrieves a document from DynamoDB based on hash and range key. The key can be string or number.For any get request all the primary keys are required (hash or hash and range based on the table keys).A Json Document ('Map') attribute of the DynamoDB item is read into the content of the FlowFile.

property.name: Table Name
property.description: The DynamoDB table name

property.name: Hash Key Name
property.description: The hash key name of the item

property.name: Range Key Name
property.description: The range key name of the item

property.name: Hash Key Value
property.description: The hash key value of the item

property.name: Hash Key Value Type
property.description: The hash key value type of the item

property.name: Range Key Value Type
property.description: The range key value type of the item

property.name: Json Document attribute
property.description: The Json document to be retrieved from the dynamodb item

property.name: Batch items for each request (between 1 and 50)
property.displayName: Batch items for each request (between 1 and 50)
property.description: The items to be retrieved in one batch

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

relationship.name: unprocessed
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to unprocessed relationship when DynamoDB is not able to process all the items in the request. Typical reasons are insufficient table throughput capacity and exceeding the maximum bytes per request. Unprocessed FlowFiles can be retried with a new request.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to failure relationship

relationship.name: not found
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to not found relationship if key not found in the table

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.key.error.unprocessed
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db unprocessed keys

writesAttribute.name: dynmodb.range.key.value.error
writesAttribute.description: Dynamod db range key error

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.key.error.not.found
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db key not found

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.exception.message
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db exception message

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.code
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error code

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.message
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error message

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.type
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error type

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.service
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error service

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.retryable
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error is retryable

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.request.id
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db error request id

writesAttribute.name: dynamodb.error.status.code
writesAttribute.description: Dynamo db status code

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.ListS3
extension.description: Retrieves a listing of objects from an S3 bucket. For each object that is listed, creates a FlowFile that represents the object so that it can be fetched in conjunction with FetchS3Object. This Processor is designed to run on Primary Node only in a cluster. If the primary node changes, the new Primary Node will pick up where the previous node left off without duplicating all of the data.

property.name: write-s3-object-tags
property.description: If set to 'True', the tags associated with the S3 object will be written as FlowFile attributes

property.name: write-s3-user-metadata
property.description: If set to 'True', the user defined metadata associated with the S3 object will be written as FlowFile attributes

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: AWS Credentials Provider service
property.description: The Controller Service that is used to obtain aws credentials provider

property.name: SSL Context Service
property.description: Specifies an optional SSL Context Service that, if provided, will be used to create connections

property.name: Endpoint Override URL
property.description: Endpoint URL to use instead of the AWS default including scheme, host, port, and path. The AWS libraries select an endpoint URL based on the AWS region, but this property overrides the selected endpoint URL, allowing use with other S3-compatible endpoints.

property.name: Signer Override
property.description: The AWS libraries use the default signer but this property allows you to specify a custom signer to support older S3-compatible services.

property.name: proxy-configuration-service
property.description: Specifies the Proxy Configuration Controller Service to proxy network requests. If set, it supersedes proxy settings configured per component. Supported proxies: HTTP + AuthN

property.name: Proxy Host
property.description: Proxy host name or IP

property.name: Proxy Host Port
property.description: Proxy host port

property.name: proxy-user-name
property.description: Proxy username

property.name: proxy-user-password
property.description: Proxy password

property.name: delimiter
property.description: The string used to delimit directories within the bucket. Please consult the AWS documentation for the correct use of this field.

property.name: prefix
property.description: The prefix used to filter the object list. In most cases, it should end with a forward slash ('/').

property.name: use-versions
property.description: Specifies whether to use S3 versions, if applicable. If false, only the latest version of each object will be returned.

property.name: list-type
property.description: Specifies whether to use the original List Objects or the newer List Objects Version 2 endpoint.

property.name: min-age
property.description: The minimum age that an S3 object must be in order to be considered; any object younger than this amount of time (according to last modification date) will be ignored

property.name: requester-pays
property.description: If true, indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with listing the S3 bucket. This sets the 'x-amz-request-payer' header to 'requester'. Note that this setting is not applicable when 'Use Versions' is 'true'.

allowableValue.description: Indicates that the requester consents to pay any charges associated with listing the S3 bucket.
Does not consent to pay requester charges for listing the S3 bucket.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles are routed to success relationship

writesAttribute.name: s3.bucket
writesAttribute.description: The name of the S3 bucket

writesAttribute.name: filename
writesAttribute.description: The name of the file

writesAttribute.name: s3.etag
writesAttribute.description: The ETag that can be used to see if the file has changed

writesAttribute.name: s3.isLatest
writesAttribute.description: A boolean indicating if this is the latest version of the object

writesAttribute.name: s3.lastModified
writesAttribute.description: The last modified time in milliseconds since epoch in UTC time

writesAttribute.name: s3.length
writesAttribute.description: The size of the object in bytes

writesAttribute.name: s3.storeClass
writesAttribute.description: The storage class of the object

writesAttribute.name: s3.version
writesAttribute.description: The version of the object, if applicable

writesAttribute.name: s3.tag.___
writesAttribute.description: If 'Write Object Tags' is set to 'True', the tags associated to the S3 object that is being listed will be written as part of the flowfile attributes

writesAttribute.name: s3.user.metadata.___
writesAttribute.description: If 'Write User Metadata' is set to 'True', the user defined metadata associated to the S3 object that is being listed will be written as part of the flowfile attributes

stateful.description: After performing a listing of keys, the timestamp of the newest key is stored, along with the keys that share that same timestamp. This allows the Processor to list only keys that have been added or modified after this date the next time that the Processor is run. State is stored across the cluster so that this Processor can be run on Primary Node only and if a new Primary Node is selected, the new node can pick up where the previous node left off, without duplicating the data.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.s3.encryption.StandardS3EncryptionService
extension.description: Adds configurable encryption to S3 Put and S3 Fetch operations.

property.name: encryption-strategy
property.description: Strategy to use for S3 data encryption and decryption.

allowableValue.description: Use server-side, KMS key to perform encryption.
Use server-side, customer-supplied key to perform encryption.
Use client-side, KMS key to perform encryption.
Use client-side, customer-supplied key to perform encryption.

property.name: key-id-or-key-material
property.description: For None and Server-side S3: not used. For Server-side KMS and Client-side KMS: the KMS Key ID must be configured. For Server-side Customer Key and Client-side Customer Key: the Key Material must be specified in Base64 encoded form. In case of Server-side Customer Key, the key must be an AES-256 key. In case of Client-side Customer Key, it can be an AES-256, AES-192 or AES-128 key.

property.name: kms-region
property.description: The Region of the AWS Key Management Service. Only used in case of Client-side KMS.

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.aws.credentials.provider.service.AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService
extension.description: Defines credentials for Amazon Web Services processors. Uses default credentials without configuration. Default credentials support EC2 instance profile/role, default user profile, environment variables, etc. Additional options include access key / secret key pairs, credentials file, named profile, and assume role credentials.

property.name: default-credentials
property.description: If true, uses the Default Credential chain, including EC2 instance profiles or roles, environment variables, default user credentials, etc.

property.name: Credentials File
property.description: Path to a file containing AWS access key and secret key in properties file format.

property.name: profile-name
property.description: The AWS profile name for credentials from the profile configuration file.

property.name: anonymous-credentials
property.description: If true, uses Anonymous credentials

property.name: Assume Role ARN
property.description: The AWS Role ARN for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with role name and session timeout

property.name: Assume Role Session Name
property.description: The AWS Role Name for cross account access. This is used in conjunction with role ARN and session time out

property.name: Session Time
property.description: Session time for role based session (between 900 and 3600 seconds). This is used in conjunction with role ARN and name

property.name: assume-role-external-id
property.description: External ID for cross-account access. This is used in conjunction with role arn, role name, and optional session time out

property.name: assume-role-proxy-host
property.description: Proxy host for cross-account access, if needed within your environment. This will configure a proxy to request for temporary access keys into another AWS account

property.name: assume-role-proxy-port
property.description: Proxy pot for cross-account access, if needed within your environment. This will configure a proxy to request for temporary access keys into another AWS account
